perturbation.original_text: 8.5 Distributor will comply with all applicable commercial and public anti-bribery laws, including, without limitation, the UK's Bribery Act  2010 and the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 ("Anti-Bribery Laws"), which prohibit (amongst other things) corrupt offers of  anything of value, either directly or indirectly, to a government official to obtain or keep business. ''Government officials" include any  government employee, candidate for public office, and employee of government-owned or government-controlled companies, public  international organisations, and political parties. Furthermore, Distributor will not make any facilitation payments, which are payments to  induce officials to perform routine functions they are otherwise obligated to perform.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.4 Force Majeure. Neither party shall be liable for failure to perform or delay in performing any obligation under this Agreement if the failure  or delay is caused by any circumstances beyond its reasonable control.

8.5 Distributor will comply with all applicable commercial and public anti-bribery laws, including, without limitation, the UK's Bribery Act  2010 and the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 ("Anti-Bribery Laws"), which prohibit (amongst other things) corrupt offers of  anything of value, either directly or indirectly, to a government official to obtain or keep business. ''Government officials" include any  government employee, candidate for public office, and employee of government-owned or government-controlled companies, public  international organisations, and political parties. Furthermore, Distributor will not make any facilitation payments, which are payments to  induce officials to perform routine functions they are otherwise obligated to perform.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the anti-bribery compliance clause from the 'Warranties' section to the 'Force Majeure' section. This placement obscures its importance and direct connection to standard business conduct warranties, reducing its enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: UK Bribery Act 2010, U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977

perturbation.original_text: 11.5 Compliance with Export Laws. Distributor shall comply with all applicable export and re-export control laws and regulations ("Export  Laws"), which the parties agree include: (a) the Export Administration Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of Commerce, (b)  trade and economic sanctions maintained by the U.S. Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control, and (c) the International  Traffic in Arms Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of State. Unless Distributor obtains prior authorisation required by  applicable Export Laws, Distributor shall not export any Product to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan or Syria.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1 Delivery. Google shall deliver the Distribution Products electronically to Distributor at a [ * ] following the Effective Date and prior to  Launch (as defined in Clause 3.4 (Launch)).

11.5 Compliance with Export Laws. Distributor shall comply with all applicable export and re-export control laws and regulations ("Export  Laws"), which the parties agree include: (a) the Export Administration Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of Commerce, (b)  trade and economic sanctions maintained by the U.S. Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control, and (c) the International  Traffic in Arms Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of State. Unless Distributor obtains prior authorisation required by  applicable Export Laws, Distributor shall not export any Product to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan or Syria.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the export compliance clause into the 'Delivery' section. This makes it less visible as a standalone obligation and buries it within logistical details, diminishing its prominence and making it harder to enforce separately. The original clause in general section 11, emphasizes the significance of export laws, which is violated when it is placed into section 3
perturbation.contradicted_law: Export Administration Regulations, International Traffic in Arms Regulations

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 Taxes. All payments under this Agreement are exclusive of taxes imposed by any governmental entity. Google shall pay any applicable  taxes imposed by governmental agencies with respect to the transactions under this Agreement other than taxes based upon  Distributor's income. Google shall promptly provide to Distributor a copy of an official tax receipt or other appropriate evidence of any  taxes imposed on payments made under this Agreement. When Distributor has the legal obligation to collect any applicable taxes, the  appropriate amount shall be invoiced to and paid by Google unless Google provides Distributor with a valid tax exemption certificate  authorised by the appropriate taxing authority.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.1 Publicity. Subject to clause 6 (Confidential Information), neither party may make any public statement regarding the relationship  contemplated by this Agreement without the other's prior written approval.

4.4 Taxes. All payments under this Agreement are exclusive of taxes imposed by any governmental entity. Google shall pay any applicable  taxes imposed by governmental agencies with respect to the transactions under this Agreement other than taxes based upon  Distributor's income. Google shall promptly provide to Distributor a copy of an official tax receipt or other appropriate evidence of any  taxes imposed on payments made under this Agreement. When Distributor has the legal obligation to collect any applicable taxes, the  appropriate amount shall be invoiced to and paid by Google unless Google provides Distributor with a valid tax exemption certificate  authorised by the appropriate taxing authority.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the tax clause from the 'Payment Terms' section to the 'Publicity' section, this hides financial obligations within communication protocols, and may prevent proper adherence. The original clause being in the payment section emphasizes the importance, which is violated when it is placed into section 11
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction (United States: IRS guidelines; United Kingdom: HMRC guidelines)
